page.title: 16Farming-Dairying-Uryside
page.content: Uryside is a farm of 170 acres lying in the flood plain of the River Ury. Formerly part of the nearby Keith Hall estate, it has belonged since 1902 to the Adam family. The present owner, Edward Adam, has farmed Uryside for the last 15 years. Its situation near the Ury means that the soil produces an abundance of lush green grass to support his pedigree herd of 80 Dutch Friesians. Mr Adam also grows barley and turnips, both for winter fodder. Mr Adam has a herring bone milking parlour. His daily yield is on average 1400 litres (15 litres per cow) which is taken by tanker to the Twin Spires Creamery at Bucksburn in Aberdeen. Bull calves are fed on barley until they are fourteen months old and slaughtered.
